title: Trace-level detection of sulfonamide antibiotics using quaternary ammonium polymeric ionic liquid-based effervescence-enhanced dispersive solid-phase extraction followed by LC-DAD analysis in environmental waters
summary: This paper presents a novel method for trace-level detection of sulfonamide antibiotics in environmental waters using quaternary ammonium polymeric ionic liquid-based effervescence-enhanced dispersive solid-phase extraction followed by LC-DAD analysis. The method integrates concentration, extraction, and quick dispersion into one synchronous step, providing satisfactory analytical indicators for trace-level SAs detection.
methodology: Effervescence-enhanced dispersive solid-phase extraction (QAP-EDSE) using quaternary ammonium polymeric ionic liquid (PIL)
research_outcomes: The proposed method provided limits of detection as low as 0.11–0.31 μg L−1 and satisfactory recoveries of 81.40–102.62% for five sulfonamides in environmental waters.

title: Complexes with Atomic Gold Ions: Efficient Bis-Ligand Formation
summary: This paper investigates the formation of complexes between atomic gold ions and various ligands, including rare gases and molecules. The research focuses on understanding the chemical reactivity of gold atoms or cations and their interactions with different ligands.
methodology: The authors used a combination of experimental and theoretical methods to study the formation of complexes between atomic gold ions and various ligands. They employed helium nanodroplets (HNDs) as a matrix to form complexes, which were then irradiated by electrons to produce cations.
research_outcomes: The authors observed pronounced intensity anomalies in the mass spectra of mixed gold-ligand cluster ions, indicating the formation of stable complexes. They also found that the propensity towards bis-ligand formation is attributed to the formation of covalent bonds in Au+L2.
sources_of_inspiration: Kapur and Müller reported a 5% yield of NeAu + upon slow field evaporation of gold in a mixture of hydrogen and neon [5].
Pyykkö calculated binding energies between Au + and several ligands, including all rare gas atoms [6].

title: Chromium-catalyzed cyclopropanation of alkenes with bromoform
summary: This paper presents a chromium-catalyzed cyclopropanation reaction of alkenes with bromoform, achieving high yields and selectivity. The reaction mechanism is investigated, and the role of the organosilicon reductant in generating a catalytically active species is discussed.
methodology: The methodology involves the use of chromium catalysts and an organosilicon reductant to facilitate the cyclopropanation reaction.
research_outcomes: High yields and selectivity were achieved in the cyclopropanation reaction, with various alkenes being converted into their corresponding bromocyclopropanes.

title: Chemical Composition and Biological Activities of Endophytic Fungus Talaromyces Wortmannii LGT-4, Cultured in CYM Medium
summary: This paper investigates the chemical composition and biological activities of endophytic fungus Talaromyces wortmannii LGT-4, cultured in CYM medium. The study isolates nine compounds with unique structures and evaluates their monoamine oxidase and phosphoinositide 3-kinase (PI3Kα) inhibitory activities.
methodology: The methodology involves culturing the fungus in CYM liquid medium, followed by extraction and isolation of compounds using NMR spectral data. Biological activities are evaluated through anti-monoamine oxidase and PI3Kα biochemical assays.
research_outcomes: Nine compounds with unique structures were isolated from Talaromyces wortmannii LGT-4, showing moderate antimonoamine oxidase activity and PI3Kα inhibitory activity.

title: Electrochemical Synthesis and Electro-Optical Properties of Dibenzothiophene/Thiophene Conjugated Polymers With Stepwise Enhanced Conjugation Lengths
summary: This paper explores the electrochemical synthesis and electro-optical properties of conjugated polymers with stepwise enhanced conjugation lengths. The study focuses on the relationship between main chain conjugation length and electrochromic properties, as well as the electrochemical redox activity and stability of the conjugated polymer.
methodology: The authors employed density functional theory (DFT) calculations to investigate the ground-state optimized molecular geometries and frontier molecular orbital distributions of DBT-Th, DBT-Th:Th, DBT-2Th, DBT-Th:2Th, DBT-2Th:Th, and DBT-2Th:2Th.
research_outcomes: The study found that longer conjugation lengths resulted in decreased HOMO-LUMO gaps in the polymers. The optical band gaps (Eg,opt) and electrochemical band gaps (Eg,cv) were decreased from PDBT-Th to PDBT-Th:Th, however, PDBT-Th:2Th, PDBT-2Th, PDBT-2Th:Th and PDBT-2Th:2Th displayed the similar band gaps.

title: Nanoparticle Conjugates of Selenium Compounds: Preparation, Characterisation and Electron Transfer
summary: This paper explores the conjugation of selenium compounds with gold nanoparticles (GNPs) and magnetic nanoparticles (MNPs), demonstrating enhanced electron transfer ability and antioxidant properties. The research focuses on modulating the redox state of organoselenium compounds by conjugating them to inorganic nanoparticles, providing new avenues for delivering these compounds.
methodology: The authors employed spectroscopic and microscopic tools such as optical absorption, Raman spectroscopy, dynamic light scattering (DLS), zeta potential, and transmission electron microscopy (TEM) to characterise the conjugates. They also used EDC-NHS coupling for bio-conjugation reactions.
research_outcomes: The studies confirmed that redox activities of selenium compounds can be modulated upon conjugation with inorganic nanoparticles, providing new avenues for delivering organoselenium compounds.

title: The Synthesis of a Novel Azo Dyes and Study of Photocatalytic Degradation
summary: This paper focuses on the synthesis of novel azo dyes and their photocatalytic degradation using titanium dioxide (TiO2) and zinc oxide (ZnO). The study finds that TiO2 exhibits higher photocatalytic activity compared to ZnO, with a degradation efficiency of 87.12%.
methodology: The authors used a photo reactor to degrade the azo dyes using UV light and measured the degradation efficiency using UV-Visible spectrophotometry.
research_outcomes: Six novel aromatic azo dyes were synthesized with good yield, and their photocatalytic degradation was studied using TiO2 and ZnO as catalysts. The results show that TiO2 is more effective than ZnO in degrading the azo dyes.

title: Direct assay of monosodium glutamate in multi-sourced bouillon cubes by first derivative potentiometric titration
summary: This paper presents a simple, cheap, and accurate analytical method for the direct assay of monosodium glutamate (MSG) in bouillon cubes. The method uses first derivative potentiometric titration and is suitable for regulatory agencies such as NAFDAC and ISO.
methodology: First derivative potentiometric titration
research_outcomes: A cheap, simple, accurate, and reproducible method for the direct determination of MSG in bouillon cubes was developed. The highest MSG content was found to be 75.14% in sample P8.

title: Selectivity control in thiol–yne click reactions via visible light induced associative electron upconversion
summary: This paper presents a metal-free approach to access different thiol-yne products with high selectivity, using visible light induced associative electron upconversion. The reaction mechanism is supported by experiments and DFT calculations.
methodology: The developed synthetic approach uses an associative electron upconversion consisting in highly reducing radical-anion formation via orbital crossing.
research_outcomes: A universal metal-free approach to access different thiol-yne products with high selectivity is presented. The reaction mechanism is supported by experiments and DFT calculations.
sources_of_inspiration: Alabugin and coworkers' work on electron upconversion and orbital crossing
Lei and co-workers' light-mediated regioselective radical synthesis of asubstituted vinyl sulfones

title: Cospatial σ-Hole and Lone Pair Interactions of Square-Pyramidal Pentavalent Halogen Compounds with π-Systems: A Quantum Mechanical Study
summary: This paper investigates the cospatial σ-hole and lone pair interactions of square-pyramidal pentavalent halogen compounds with π-systems using quantum mechanical methods. The study focuses on understanding the nature and attitude of noncovalent interactions, particularly in aromatic π-system-based interactions.
methodology: Quantum chemical calculations were used to investigate the σ-hole/lp···π-system interactions. Molecular electrostatic potential (MEP) maps and electron localization function (ELF) representations were employed to analyze the noncovalent interactions in terms of the topology of electron density.
research_outcomes: The study found that the σ-hole interaction had a power over the lp interactions. The molecular stabilization energies resulting from incorporating negative and positive PoCs were inversely correlated with the Cl···PoC distance for the systems understudy.

title: H2S/Thiols, NO•, and NO–/HNO: Interactions with Iron Porphyrins
summary: This paper explores the interactions between H2S, thiols, NO•, and NO–/HNO with iron porphyrins. The study focuses on the reactivity of inorganic sulfide species towards iron heme platforms, providing insights into the coordination chemistry of H2S and its conjugated base to heme proteins.
methodology: The authors use model compounds as representatives of heme proteins to investigate the biorelevant sulfide coordination chemistry with heme model compounds.
research_outcomes: The study reveals that free ferric porphyrinates are reduced by inorganic sulfide in aqueous solution, and ferrous sulfide complexes have been obtained in organic media. A low-spin Fe(III)−SH intermediate was identified during the reduction of ferric porphyrins by sulfide at low temperature.

title: Preparation of Nano-Copper Sulfide and Its Adsorption Properties for 17α-Ethynyl Estradiol
summary: This paper focuses on the synthesis of nano-copper sulfide and its application as an adsorbent for removing 17α-ethynyl estradiol (EE2) from water. The study demonstrates that copper sulfide exhibits excellent adsorption properties, with a maximum adsorption capacity of 147.06 mg/g.
methodology: The methodology involves the synthesis of nano-copper sulfide using a hydrothermal method and its characterization by XRD, SEM, TEM, and BET. The adsorption properties of copper sulfide on EE2 were studied through experimental data.
research_outcomes: The study shows that copper sulfide is a stable and efficient adsorbent with promising practical applications for removing EE2 from water.

title: Computational Studies on Drug Likeness and Pharmacokinetic Profile of Selected Phytoconstituents from Liquorice
summary: This paper investigates the drug likeness properties and pharmacokinetic profile of selected phytoconstituents from liquorice using computational methods. The study uses servers such as PubChem, Molsoft, and admetSAR to predict molecular properties and pharmacokinetic aspects, but does not involve machine learning or artificial intelligence.
methodology: The study employs a computational approach using server-based technology to investigate the drug likeness properties and pharmacokinetic profile of selected phytoconstituents from liquorice.
research_outcomes: The study identifies several phytoconstituents as good drug-like candidates, but does not provide any significant new insights or contributions in the field of machine learning or artificial intelligence.

title: Recent Advance in Co3O4 and Co3O4-Containing Electrode Materials for High-Performance Supercapacitors
summary: This paper reviews the recent advances in Co3O4 and Co3O4-containing electrode materials for high-performance supercapacitors, focusing on their synthesis methods, properties, and applications. The authors discuss various techniques used to synthesize these materials, including hydrothermal and solvothermal methods, and highlight their potential for energy storage.
methodology: The paper reviews the synthesis methods of Co3O4 and Co3O4-containing electrode materials, including hydrothermal and solvothermal methods. The authors discuss the properties and applications of these materials in supercapacitors.
research_outcomes: The review highlights the potential of Co3O4 and Co3O4-containing electrode materials for high-performance supercapacitors, with improved specific capacitance, energy density, and power density. The authors also discuss the challenges and future outlook for these materials.

title: Conversion of waste polypropylene disposable cups into liquid fuels by thermal and catalytic pyrolysis using activated carbon
summary: This paper focuses on converting waste polypropylene disposable cups into liquid fuels through thermal and catalytic pyrolysis processes. The study explores the effect of temperature, feed to catalyst ratio, and reaction times on yield of liquid fuel fraction in both thermal and catalytic processes.
methodology: The authors employed thermal and catalytic pyrolysis processes using activated carbon as a catalyst to convert waste polypropylene disposable cups into liquid fuels. The study involved characterization of WPP plastics through proximate and ultimate analyses, TGA, and XRD/SEM analysis.
research_outcomes: The authors reported an optimum liquid yield of 74% in catalytic pyrolysis at 510°C with a residence time of 35 min. The thermo-physical properties of optimal liquid products were comparable with conventional fossil fuels.

title: Spectral characteristics and DFT Study of vanadyl octaethylporphyrin complex
summary: This paper explores the chemistry of vanadyl porphyrins using vanadyl octaethylporphyrin as a substance in petroleum porphyrins, crude oils and bitumen. The study uses Density Functional Theory (DFT) to determine the geometric and electronic structure of the complex, but does not involve any machine learning or artificial intelligence methods.
methodology: The paper uses DFT calculations at the B3LYP/6-31G(d) level to optimize the molecular structure and calculate various properties such as infrared spectrum, vibrational frequencies, and electrostatic potential.
research_outcomes: The study reports on the characterization of VO(II) adducts with octaethylporphyrin using quantum chemical calculations. The results show that the complex has a pseudo-square pyramidal geometry and that the V-N bond is formed through direct donation from the nitrogen atoms to the vanadyl ion.

title: Validation and Application of a Derivatization-Free RP-HPLC-DAD Method for the Determination of Low Molecular Weight Salivary Metabolites
summary: This paper presents a novel, derivatization-free RP-HPLC-DAD method for the simultaneous determination of low molecular weight metabolites in saliva. The method is validated and applied to investigate the dynamics of salivary metabolites as potential biomarkers for non-invasive 'personal monitoring' during drug treatments, work out, or life habits over time.
methodology: The authors developed a high-throughput, direct, low-cost reversed phase liquid chromatographic method with diode array detection without any pre- or post-column derivatization. The method was optimized and validated using a saliva pool sample spiked with metabolites at various concentration levels.
research_outcomes: The study demonstrated the potential of the proposed method for the simultaneous determination of low molecular weight metabolites in saliva, including organic acids, amino acids, and other carbonyl compounds. The results showed good linearity, precision, and accuracy of the method.

title: Adsorption of Light Gases in Covalent Organic Frameworks: Comparison of Classical Density Functional Theory and Grand Canonical Monte Carlo Simulations
summary: This paper compares the performance of classical density functional theory (cDFT) and grand canonical Monte Carlo (GCMC) simulations in predicting adsorption isotherms of light gases in covalent organic frameworks (COFs). The study uses a PC-SAFT equation of state to describe fluid-fluid interactions, but does not involve any machine learning or artificial intelligence methods.
methodology: The paper employs classical density functional theory and grand canonical Monte Carlo simulations to predict adsorption isotherms in COFs. The cDFT model uses a PC-SAFT equation of state to describe fluid-fluid interactions, while the GCMC simulations use the TraPPE force field.
research_outcomes: The study finds excellent agreement between cDFT and GCMC predictions for adsorption isotherms up to pressures of 50 bar. The results suggest that the PC-SAFT DFT model can accurately predict selective accumulation of longer hydrocarbons in binary mixtures.

title: Microstructure Optimization of Mos2/Sepiolite Nanocomposites via a Surfactant-Assisted Hydrothermal Strategy for High Efficiency Photocatalysis
summary: This paper focuses on optimizing the microstructure of MoS2/sepiolite nanocomposites using a surfactant-assisted hydrothermal method. The study investigates the effects of different surfactants and concentrations on the photocatalytic activity of the nanocomposite, with SDBS found to be the optimal surfactant at 1 mol/L concentration.
methodology: Surfactant-assisted hydrothermal method
research_outcomes: The study finds that MoS2/sepiolite nanocomposite prepared with 1 mol/L SDBS exhibits the highest photocatalytic activity, with a degradation efficiency of RhB reaching about 93% after irradiation of 150 minutes.

title: Characterization of Nanosilica and Comparing Its Effect on Crude Oils and Diesel Fuel
summary: This paper investigates the viscosity reduction of heavy oil resulting from the presence of silica nanoparticles by asphaltene adsorption process. The study uses chemical and physical methods to produce silica nanoparticles, which are then added to crude oils and diesel fuel to measure their effect on viscosity.
methodology: The paper uses a combination of chemical and physical methods to produce silica nanoparticles, including mixing sand with NaOH in a stirred refluxing unit and filtering the resulting slurry.
research_outcomes: The study finds that the addition of silica nanoparticles reduces the viscosity of heavy oil, making it easier to transport through pipelines. The results are attributed to the adsorption of asphaltenes on nanoparticle surfaces, which decreases their ability to interact with each other.

title: QSAR-based rational discovery of novel substituted-4′-iminospiro[indoline-3,3′-[1,2,5]thiadiazolidinyl]-2-one 1′,1′-dioxide with potent in vitro anticancer activity
summary: This paper presents a QSAR-based approach to design novel AR inhibitors with potential anticancer activities. The study uses a quantitative structure-activity relationship (QSAR) model to predict the biological activity of newly designed compounds, and identifies molecular descriptors that contribute to the AR inhibition.
methodology: The methodology involves building a QSAR model for AR inhibitors using a series of potent aldose reductase inhibitors. The main aim is to derive important descriptors that contribute to the AR inhibition, and to use these descriptors to predict the biological activity of newly designed compounds.
statistics: Regression analysis was used to evaluate each set of molecular descriptors, with an ideal set generating a model with least root mean square error (RMSE) and a r2 coefficient value close to 1.00.
research_outcomes: The study identifies novel AR inhibitors with potential anticancer activities, and presents a QSAR-based approach for predicting the biological activity of newly designed compounds.

title: Fabrication of Magnetic Catalyst Fe3O4-SiO2-V3 and Its Application on Lignin Extraction from Corncob in Deep Eutectic Solvent
summary: This paper focuses on the development of a magnetic catalyst, Fe3O4-SiO2-V3, for lignin extraction from corncob in deep eutectic solvent. The study explores the application of polyoxometalates as catalysts to optimize delignification processes.
methodology: The methodology involves the preparation of Fe3O4-SiO2-V3 by depositing H6PMo9V3O40 on Fe3O4-SiO2. The catalyst is then employed for lignin extraction from corncob in deep eutectic solvent.
research_outcomes: The study reports the successful preparation of Fe3O4-SiO2-V3 and its application in lignin extraction. The results indicate improved lignin quality, with increased extraction rate and purity.

title: Conformational sampling and kinetics changes across a non-Arrhenius break point in the enzyme thermolysin
summary: This paper investigates conformational sampling and kinetics changes across a non-Arrhenius break point in the enzyme thermolysin. The study uses room temperature crystallography to reveal motions crucial for catalysis, ligand binding, and alternate conformations of protein side chains. However, machine learning or artificial intelligence methods are not used in this research.
methodology: The study employs room temperature crystallography, circular dichroism (CD), and fluorescence spectroscopy to investigate conformational sampling and kinetics changes in thermolysin.
research_outcomes: The study finds a non-Arrhenius transition point in the kinetics of thermolysin at 26 C, suggesting a conformational sampling transition may exist at this temperature. The results provide insight into how protein conformational sampling affects enzyme catalysis.

title: Cytotoxic and antileishmanial triterpenes of Tabebuia aurea (Silva Manso) leaves
summary: This paper investigates the cytotoxic and antileishmanial activities of triterpenes isolated from Tabebuia aurea leaves. The study found that certain compounds exhibited significant cytotoxic activity against cancer cell lines and antileishmanial activity, but machine learning or artificial intelligence methods were not used in this research.
methodology: Bioassay-guided fractionation of the total ethanolic extract and sub-fractions of the leaves of T. aurea
statistics: IC50 values for cytotoxicity and antileishmanial activity were measured
research_outcomes: Six triterpenoidal compounds were isolated, which exhibited varied cytotoxic activities against tumor cell lines and anti-leishmania activity.

title: Destruction of Chitosan and Its Complexes with Cobalt(II) and Copper(II) Tetrasulphophthalocyanines
summary: This paper investigates the thermal oxidative destruction of chitosan in the presence of metallophthalocyanine complexes. The study aims to understand how these complexes affect the degradation process and potentially lead to new polymer compositions with improved oxidation resistance.
methodology: The authors used thermogravimetric analysis (TG/DTG) and mass spectrometry to study the thermal oxidative destruction of chitosan in air and inert atmospheres. They also synthesized and purified metallophthalocyanine complexes using various methods.
research_outcomes: The results show that metallophthalocyanines can exhibit antioxidant activity in the thermal oxidation of chitosan, potentially leading to new polymer compositions with improved oxidation resistance.
